an1.21:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ akammaniyaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.21:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is as unworkable as the mind.

an1.22:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ kammaniyaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.22:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is as workable as the mind.

an1.23:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.23:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed like this, is so very harmful as the mind.

an1.23:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.23:1.2.eng: An undeveloped mind is very harmful.”

an1.24:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.24:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed like this, is so very beneficial as the mind.

an1.24:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.24:1.2.eng: A developed mind is very beneficial.”

an1.25:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ apātubhūtaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.25:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed, with such untapped potential, is so very harmful as the mind.

an1.25:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ apātubhūtaṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.25:1.2.eng: An undeveloped mind, with untapped potential, is very harmful.”

an1.26:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ pātubhūtaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.26:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed, with its potential realized, is so very beneficial as the mind.

an1.26:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ pātubhūtaṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.26:1.2.eng: A developed mind, with its potential realized, is very beneficial.”

an1.27:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, is so very harmful as the mind.

an1.27:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ mahato anatthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.27:1.2.eng: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind is very harmful.”

an1.28:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattati yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.28:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, is so very beneficial as the mind.

an1.28:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ mahato atthāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.28:1.2.eng: A developed and cultivated mind is very beneficial.”

an1.29:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ dukkhādhivahaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.29:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it’s not developed and cultivated, brings such suffering as the mind.

an1.29:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ abahulīkataṃ dukkhādhivahaṃ hotī”ti.
an1.29:1.2.eng: An undeveloped and uncultivated mind brings suffering.”

an1.30:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ sukhādhivahaṃ hoti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ.
an1.30:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated, brings such happiness as the mind.

an1.30:1.2.pli: Cittaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ sukhādhivahaṃ hotī”ti.
an1.30:1.2.eng: A developed and cultivated mind brings happiness.”

an1.219:1.1.pli: “Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahussutānaṃ yadidaṃ ānando.
an1.219:1.1.eng: “The foremost of my monk disciples who are very learned is Ānanda.

an1.220:1.1.eng: … with a good memory is Ānanda.

an1.221:1.1.eng: … with an extensive range is Ānanda.

an1.223:1.1.eng: … as a personal attendant is Ānanda.

an1.224:1.1.eng: … with a large congregation is Kassapa of Uruvelā.

an1.225:1.1.eng: … who inspire lay families is Kāḷudāyī.

an1.227:1.1.eng: … who recollect past lives is Sobhita.

an1.228:1.1.eng: … who have memorized the monastic law is Upāli.

an1.229:1.1.eng: … who advise the nuns is Nandaka.

an1.230:1.1.eng: … who guard the sense doors is Nanda.

an1.231:1.1.eng: … who advise the monks is Mahākappina.

an1.232:1.1.eng: … who are skilled in the fire element is Sāgata.

an1.233:1.1.eng: … who inspire eloquent teachings is Rādha.

an1.234:1.1.eng: … who wear coarse robes is Mogharāja.”

an1.235:1.1.pli: “Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ rattaññūnaṃ yadidaṃ mahāpajāpatigotamī.
an1.235:1.1.eng: “The foremost of my nun disciples in long standing is Mahāpajāpati Gotamī.

an1.238:1.1.eng: … who have memorized the monastic law is Paṭācārā.

an1.239:1.1.eng: … who speak on the teaching is Dhammadinnā.

an1.243:1.1.eng: … with swift insight is Bhaddā of the Curly Hair.

an1.244:1.1.eng: … who recollect past lives is Bhaddā daughter of Kapila.

an1.245:1.1.eng: … who have attained great insight is Bhaddakaccānā.

an1.246:1.1.eng: … who wear coarse robes is Kisāgotamī.

an1.247:1.1.eng: … who are committed to faith is Siṅgāla’s Mother.”

an1.248:1.1.pli: “Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ upāsakānaṃ paṭhamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchantānaṃ yadidaṃ tapussabhallikā vāṇijā.
an1.248:1.1.eng: “The foremost of my laymen in first going for refuge are the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika.

an1.249:1.1.eng: … as a donor is the householder Sudatta Anāthapiṇḍika.

an1.250:1.1.eng: … who speak on the teaching is the householder Citta Macchikāsaṇḍika.

an1.251:1.1.pli: … Catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi parisaṃ saṅgaṇhantānaṃ yadidaṃ hatthako āḷavako.
an1.251:1.1.eng: … who attract a congregation by the four ways of being inclusive is Hatthaka of Āḷavī.

an1.252:1.1.eng: … who donate fine things is Mahānāma Sakka.

an1.253:1.1.eng: … who donate nice things is the householder Ugga of Vesālī.

an1.254:1.1.eng: … who attend on the Saṅgha is the householder Uggata of Elephant Village.

an1.255:1.1.eng: … who have experiential confidence is Sūrambaṭṭha.

an1.256:1.1.eng: … who have confidence in an individual is Jīvaka Komārabhacca.

an1.257:1.1.eng: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s father.”

an1.258:1.1.pli: “Etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ paṭhamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchantīnaṃ yadidaṃ sujātā seniyadhītā.
an1.258:1.1.eng: “The foremost of my laywomen in first going for refuge is Sujātā the general’s daughter.

an1.259:1.1.eng: … as a donor is Visākhā, Migāra’s mother.

an1.260:1.1.eng: … who are very learned is Khujjuttarā.

an1.261:1.1.eng: … who dwell in love is Sāmāvatī.

an1.262:1.1.eng: … who practice absorption is Uttarā, Nanda’s mother.

an1.263:1.1.eng: … who give fine things is Suppavāsā the Koliyan.

an1.264:1.1.eng: … who care for the sick is the laywoman Suppiyā.

an1.265:1.1.eng: … who have experiential confidence is Kātiyānī.

an1.266:1.1.eng: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s mother.

an1.267:1.1.eng: … whose confidence is based on oral transmission is the laywoman Kāḷī of Kuraraghara.”

an1.268:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato upagaccheyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.268:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to take any condition as permanent. That is not possible.

an1.268:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.268:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as permanent. That is possible.”

an1.269:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhato upagaccheyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.269:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to take any condition as pleasant.

an1.269:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.269:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take some condition as pleasant.”

an1.270:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci dhammaṃ attato upagaccheyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.270:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to take anything as self.

an1.270:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano kañci dhammaṃ attato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.270:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to take something as self.”

an1.271:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo mātaraṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.271:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to murder their mother.

an1.271:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano mātaraṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.271:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder their mother.”

an1.272:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo pitaraṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.272:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to murder their father.

an1.272:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano pitaraṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.272:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder their father.”

an1.273:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo arahantaṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.273:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to murder a perfected one.

an1.273:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano arahantaṃ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.273:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to murder a perfected one.”

an1.274:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo tathāgatassa paduṭṭhacitto lohitaṃ uppādeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.274:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.

an1.274:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano tathāgatassa paduṭṭhacitto lohitaṃ uppādeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.274:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to injure a Realized One with malicious intent.”

an1.275:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo saṅghaṃ bhindeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.275:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.

an1.275:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano saṅghaṃ bhindeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.275:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to cause a schism in the Saṅgha.”

an1.276:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddiseyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.276:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an individual accomplished in view to dedicate themselves to another teacher.

an1.276:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puthujjano aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddiseyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.276:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an ordinary person to dedicate themselves to another teacher.”

an1.277:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjeyyuṃ. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.277:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for two perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas to arise in the same solar system at the same time.

an1.277:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ ekissā lokadhātuyā ekova arahaṃ sammāsambuddho uppajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.277:1.2.eng: But it is possible for just one perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, to arise in one solar system.”

an1.278:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve rājāno cakkavattī apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjeyyuṃ. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.278:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.

an1.278:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ ekissā lokadhātuyā eko rājā cakkavattī uppajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.278:1.2.eng: But it is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.”

an1.279:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ itthī arahaṃ assa sammāsambuddho. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.279:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.

an1.279:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho, etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puriso arahaṃ assa sammāsambuddho. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.279:1.2.eng: But it is possible for a man to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.”

an1.280:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ itthī rājā assa cakkavattī. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.280:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.

an1.280:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puriso rājā assa cakkavattī. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.280:1.2.eng: But it is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.”

an1.281-283:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ itthī sakkattaṃ kāreyya …pe… mārattaṃ kāreyya …pe… brahmattaṃ kāreyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.281-283:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a woman to perform the role of Sakka, Māra, or the Divinity.

an1.281-283:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ puriso sakkattaṃ kāreyya …pe… mārattaṃ kāreyya …pe… brahmattaṃ kāreyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.281-283:1.2.eng: But it is possible for a man to perform the role of Sakka, Māra, or the Divinity.”

an1.284:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ kāyaduccaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.284:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.

an1.284:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ kāyaduccaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.284:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.”

an1.285-286:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ vacīduccaritassa …pe… yaṃ manoduccaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.285-286:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad verbal … bad mental conduct.

an1.285-286:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ manoduccaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.285-286:1.2.eng: But it is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad verbal … bad mental conduct.”

an1.287:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ kāyasucaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.287:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.

an1.287:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ kāyasucaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.287:1.2.eng: But it is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.”

an1.288-289:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ vacīsucaritassa …pe… manosucaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.288-289:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good verbal … good mental conduct.

an1.288-289:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ manosucaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.288-289:1.2.eng: But it is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good verbal … good mental conduct.”

an1.290:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an1.290:1.1.eng: “It is impossible, mendicants, it cannot happen that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct, could for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

an1.290:1.2.pli: Ṭhānañca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṃ kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an1.290:1.2.eng: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

an1.291-292:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ vacīduccaritasamaṅgī …pe… yaṃ manoduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

an1.291-292:1.2.eng: But it is possible that someone who has engaged in bad verbal … bad mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

an1.296:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
an1.296:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

an1.296:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.296:1.4.eng: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”

an1.297-305:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
an1.297-305:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

an1.297-305:1.3.pli: Dhammānussati …pe… saṅghānussati … sīlānussati … cāgānussati … devatānussati … ānāpānassati … maraṇassati … kāyagatāsati … upasamānussati.
an1.297-305:1.3.eng: Recollection of the teaching … Recollection of the Saṅgha … Recollection of ethical conduct … Recollection of generosity … Recollection of the deities … Mindfulness of breathing … Mindfulness of death … Mindfulness of the body … Recollection of peace.

an1.297-305:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.297-305:1.4.eng: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
